page.title: 09JOBS IN BLACK TORRINGTON
page.content: The working population of the village follows a wide variety of occupations. Of 65 adults surveyed, the largest single occupation was building with 7, though there are also 48 old age pensioners. Only two were wholly unemployed. The full list is: building trade 7,farming 6,teachers 4,factory workers,caretakers,shop workers all 3, woodworkers,clay workers (at Meeth Quarry),cooks,mechanics,publicans, receptionists,milkmen all 2, and one rector,salesman,old people's warden, upholsterer,car dealer,butcher,lorry driver housekeeper,saddler,glazier, electrician,home help,music teacher, hairdresser,typist, school infant helper, council workman, undertaker, newsagent, office worker,postman, baker's roundsman, hospital worker. Outside the village there are about 20 farmers in the area of the block.
